text: <@U33QKSGRK|piyo> has joined the channel
now,I git clone fabric again,and there's no membersrvc,

<@U2HB9CE1Y> the master branch is a work in progress for v1. You need to checkout the v0.6 branch if you're working with membersrvc still.
`git checkout v0.6` should do it
Thank U
<@U2W7U5UA3> how to issues CA？
<@U33CM6NV7|streich> has joined the channel
<@U34PV69M4|oleksbor> has joined the channel
<@U33DXHP4G|bealdh> has joined the channel

Regarding to a query timeout.
Our current chaincode is really heavy, and we need to do a lot of thing during query.
The question is, whenever the query take too long, probably more than 30 secs. we always got the segmentation fault, and crash the validator node.
Any suggestion on this?

Note: we currently use 0.6 branch.
crashing the node is a bug regardless, so please file a jira
hi I am new here. Anyone have a suggestion for how I could contribute to the project?
<@U33DXHP4G>  checkout the link <https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#contributing-to-the-project>

attachments.title: Hyperledger Fabric
attachments.text: Welcome to the Hyperledger fabric documentation

text: would you recommend that I take a look around and try to identify something to contribute to?
In this link you will find out everything like how to setup dev environment, how to submit pull request to gerrit, coding standards etc it is self explanatory. you might check the given link.
yeah ok I set up everything and understand the coding standards. I just do not understand what help is needed specifically or where I would be useful

Create a linux foundation id and sign in on <https://jira.hyperledger.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa> checkout the existing issues and which issue is not assigned to anyone yet, comment on issue to request to assign issue to you. Then fix that issue and submit your pull request to gerrit
ah, thank you
Thanks <@U0KPFAZNF> I will create an issue there soon.

I have some other questions,

1. Is it possible to getState() concurrently? is there any lock? Can I actually getState in parallel?
2. For every single chaincode, we will get its chainhash once deployment. However, in the case that we need to modify the chaincode, we will have a different hash. The question is that, how can we retain those states from the old chaincode to the new one. Is it possible to do?
<@U33DXHP4G>  Checkout this link <https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/abstract_v1/#how-to-contribute> also
<@U1F1CU61Y> very helpful, thanks
